div.p: Prevention of Lyme borreliosis: SDG targets, key interactions among targets, and policy options for prevention.

tr.td: Increasing knowledge among the population about the relationship between green spaces, ticks and disease transmission.
When developing green spaces, increase local educational programs on personal protection
The development of urban green spaces for leisure and mobility, create new tick habitats and with that risk of contracting Lyme borreliosis increases.
When developing green spaces, make them resilient to ticks
With the development of urban green spaces, the well-being of inhabitants will improve
Encourage the development of tick resilient green spaces
The development of urban green spaces to counter the heat island effect creates new tick habitats and with that risk of contracting Lyme borreliosis increases.
Encourage the development of tick resilient green spaces
Measures to dampen or slow down climate change (mitigation) will also halt the Northern expansion of the tick distribution

The implementation of sustainable management of all forests will halt deforestation, restore degraded forests and sustainably increase afforestation globally. However, it will also likely expand the tick habitat.
To minimize the risk of humans to tick bites in forest, decrease the tick densities in nature campsites by keeping the deer out e.g., by means of enclosures

fn.p: Positive interactions are assigned scores +1 (“enabling”), +2 (“reinforcing”), or +3 (“indivisible”), while interactions characterized by trade-offs are scored with −1 (“constraining”), −2 (“counteracting”), and −3 (“canceling”).
